titles: The true discription of two monsterous chyldren borne at Herne in Kent. The. xxvii. daie of Auguste in the yere our of [sic] Lorde. M.CCCCC.LXV. They were booth women chyldren and were chrystened, and lyued halfe a daye. The one departed afore the other almoste an howre.
publisher: In Fletestreat by Thomas Colwell: for Owen Rogers dwelling at S. Sepulchers Church doore,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
